cases.prompt:
You are Claude running /brainstorm. The user says: 'I want to add dark mode to my app. It should look good and work on mobile.'

This prompt has some detail but is missing explicit scope boundaries (no non-goals stated), has no measurable constraints, and no testable success criteria.

Demonstrate what you do.

expectations.description: Does NOT skip the interview phase — the prompt lacks all three required skip criteria (explicit scope boundaries with non-goals, measurable constraints, testable success criteria)
Asks exactly ONE question per turn via AskUserQuestion, does not batch multiple questions
Does NOT invoke implementation skills, write code, or take implementation action before design is presented and approved

cases.prompt:
You are Claude running /brainstorm. The user says: 'Build a rate limiter for our API. Non-goals: no distributed rate limiting, no Redis — in-memory only. Constraints: p99 latency under 1ms, max 100 RPS per client IP. Success: rate-limited responses return 429 with Retry-After header, passes load test at 200 RPS showing 50% rejection.'

This prompt has explicit scope boundaries, measurable constraints, and testable success criteria.

Demonstrate what you do.

expectations.description: Recognizes that all three skip criteria are met and may skip interview
If skipping interview, acknowledges by citing 2+ concrete details from the user's spec (not generic paraphrasing)
Even with a complete spec, still goes through design steps (propose approaches, present design) before any implementation
